features.desc: A black seal to the left of the portrait bears the name of the distributing Federal Reserve Bank.
features.label: Black seal

features.desc: Move your finger along the note’s surface to feel the raised printing, which gives genuine Federal Reserve notes their distinctive texture.
features.label: Raised printing

features.desc: Federal Reserve note paper is one-fourth linen and three-fourths cotton, and contains red and blue security fibers.
features.label: Paper

features.desc: The $5 note features a portrait of Abraham Lincoln on the front of the note. The vignette on the back of the note features the Lincoln Memorial.
features.label: Portrait and vignette

features.desc: A seal to the right of the portrait represents the U.S. Department of the Treasury.
features.label: Green Seal

features.desc: A combination of numbers and letters appears twice on the front of the note.
features.label: Serial numbers

possibleDefects.desc: The seal of the Federal Reserve Bank is wrong or is not in the right place.
possibleDefects.label: Black seal

possibleDefects.desc: The note doesn't have raised printing on the surface.
possibleDefects.label: Raised printing

possibleDefects.desc: The papel is wrong or doesn't contain small red and blue fibers.
possibleDefects.label: Paper

possibleDefects.desc: The portrait or the vignette are wrong.
possibleDefects.label: Portrait and vignette

features.desc: A black seal to the left of the portrait which bears the name and corresponding letter of the distributing Federal Reserve Bank.
features.label: Black seal

features.desc: Move your finger along the note’s surface to feel the raised printing, which gives genuine Federal Reserve notes their distinctive texture.
features.label: Raised printing

features.desc: Federal Reserve note paper is one-fourth linen and three-fourths cotton, and contains red and blue security fibers.
features.label: Paper

features.desc: The $5 note features a portrait of Abraham Lincoln on the front of the note. The vignette on the back of the note features the Lincoln Memorial.
features.label: Portrait and vignette

features.desc: A seal to the right of the portrait represents the U.S. Department of the Treasury.
features.label: Green Seal

features.desc: A unique combination of numbers and letters that appears twice on the front of the note.
features.label: Serial numbers

keyFeatures.desc: Hold the note to light to see an embedded thread running vertically to the left of the Federal Reserve Bank seal. The thread is imprinted with the letters USA and the word FIVE in an alternating pattern and is visible from both sides of the note. The thread glows blue when illuminated by ultraviolet light.
keyFeatures.label: Security thread

keyFeatures.desc: Look carefully (magnification may be necessary) to see the small printed words THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA along the outer edge of the portrait’s oval frame.
keyFeatures.label: Microprinting

possibleDefects.desc: The thread is not embedded, doesn't have the right format or doesn't glow blue when illuminated by ultraviolet light.
possibleDefects.label: Security thread

possibleDefects.desc: The small words THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA are not along the outer edge of the portrait’s oval frame, or are badly printed.
possibleDefects.label: Microprinting

possibleDefects.desc: The seal of the Federal Reserve Bank is wrong or is not in the right place.
possibleDefects.label: Black seal

possibleDefects.desc: The note doesn't have raised printing on the surface.
possibleDefects.label: Raised printing

possibleDefects.desc: The papel is wrong or doesn't contain small red and blue fibers.
possibleDefects.label: Paper

possibleDefects.desc: The portrait or the vignette are wrong.
possibleDefects.label: Portrait and vignette

possibleDefects.desc: The seal of the U.S. Department of the Treasury is wrong or isn't in the right place.
possibleDefects.label: Green seal

possibleDefects.desc: The serial numbers are badly printed or don't have the right format.
possibleDefects.label: Serial numbers

features.desc: A black seal to the left of the portrait represents the entire Federal Reserve System. A letter and number beneath the left serial number identifies the distributing Federal Reserve Bank.
features.label: Black seal

features.desc: Look carefully (magnification may be necessary) to see the small printed words FIVE DOLLARS inside the left and right borders of the note and UNITED STATES OF AMERICA along the lower edge of the portrait’s oval frame.
features.label: Microprinting

features.desc: Move your finger along the note’s surface to feel the raised printing, which gives genuine Federal Reserve notes their distinctive texture.
features.label: Raised printing

features.desc: Federal Reserve note paper is one-fourth linen and three-fourths cotton, and contains red and blue security fibers.
features.label: Paper

features.desc: The $5 note features a portrait of Abraham Lincoln on the front of the note. The vignette on the back of the note features the Lincoln Memorial.
features.label: Portrait and vignette

features.desc: A seal to the right of the portrait represents the U.S. Department of the Treasury.
features.label: Green Seal

features.desc: A unique combination of eleven numbers and letters appears twice on the front of the note.
features.label: Serial numbers

keyFeatures.desc: Hold the note to light to see an embedded thread running vertically to the left of the portrait. The thread is imprinted with the text USA FIVE and a small flag in an alternating pattern and is visible from both sides of the note. The thread glows blue when illuminated by ultraviolet light.
keyFeatures.label: Security thread

keyFeatures.desc: Hold the note to light and look for a faint image of President Lincoln in the blank space to the right of the portrait. The image is visible from both sides of the note.
keyFeatures.label: Watermark

possibleDefects.desc: The thread is not embedded, doesn't have the right format or doesn't glow blue when illuminated by ultraviolet light.
possibleDefects.label: Security thread

possibleDefects.desc: The watermark is not in the right place, isn't visible from both sides or doesn't have the right format.
possibleDefects.label: Watermark

possibleDefects.desc: The seal of the Federal Reserve System is wrong or is not in the right place.
possibleDefects.label: Black seal

possibleDefects.desc: The small text THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA or FIVE DOLLARS are not in the right place or are badly printed.
possibleDefects.label: Microprinting

possibleDefects.desc: The note doesn't have raised printing on the surface.
possibleDefects.label: Raised printing

possibleDefects.desc: The papel is wrong or doesn't contain small red and blue fibers.
possibleDefects.label: Paper

possibleDefects.desc: The portrait or the vignette are wrong.
possibleDefects.label: Portrait and vignette

possibleDefects.desc: The seal of the U.S. Department of the Treasury is wrong or isn't in the right place.
possibleDefects.label: Green seal

possibleDefects.desc: The serial numbers are badly printed or don't have the right format.
possibleDefects.label: Serial numbers

features.desc: A black seal to the left of the portrait represents the entire Federal Reserve System. A letter and number beneath the left serial number identifies the distributing Federal Reserve Bank.
features.label: Black seal

features.desc: Look carefully (magnification may be necessary) to see the small printed text FIVE DOLLARS repeated inside the left and right borders of the note, E PLURIBUS UNUM at the top of the shield within the Great Seal, and USA repeated in between the columns of the shield. On the back of the note the text USA FIVE appears along one edge of the large purple numeral 5.
features.label: Microprinting

features.desc: Move your finger along the note’s surface to feel the raised printing, which gives genuine Federal Reserve notes their distinctive texture.
features.label: Raised printing

features.desc: Federal Reserve note paper is one-fourth linen and three-fourths cotton, and contains red and blue security fibers.
features.label: Paper

features.desc: The center of the note is light purple, blending to gray near the edges.
features.label: Color

features.desc: The $5 note features a portrait of Abraham Lincoln on the front of the note. The vignette on the back of the note features the Lincoln Memorial.
features.label: Portrait and vignette

features.desc: The Great Seal of the United States, featuring an eagle and shield, is printed in purple to the right of the portrait of President Lincoln. An arc of purple stars surrounds the portrait and The Great Seal.
features.label: Symbols of freedom

features.desc: A seal to the right of the portrait represents the U.S. Department of the Treasury.
features.label: Green Seal

features.desc: A unique combination of eleven numbers and letters appears twice on the front of the note.
features.label: Serial numbers

keyFeatures.desc: Hold the note to light and look for a faint image of three numeral 5s to the left of the portrait. The image is visible from both sides of the note.
keyFeatures.label: Watermark

keyFeatures.desc: Hold the note to light to see an embedded thread running vertically to the right of the portrait. The thread is imprinted with the letters USA and the numeral 5 in an alternating pattern and is visible from both sides of the note. The thread glows blue when illuminated by ultraviolet light.
keyFeatures.label: Security thread

keyFeatures.desc: Hold the note to light and look for a faint image of a large numeral 5 in the blank space to the right of the portrait. The image is visible from both sides of the note.
keyFeatures.label: Watermark

possibleDefects.desc: One or both of the watermarks is not in the right place, isn't visible from both sides or doesn't have the right format.
possibleDefects.label: Watermarks

possibleDefects.desc: The thread is not embedded, doesn't have the right format or doesn't glow blue when illuminated by ultraviolet light.
possibleDefects.label: Security thread

possibleDefects.desc: The seal of the Federal Reserve System is wrong or is not in the right place.
possibleDefects.label: Black seal

possibleDefects.desc: Some of the small words are not in the right place or are badly printed.
possibleDefects.label: Microprinting

possibleDefects.desc: The note doesn't have raised printing on the surface.
possibleDefects.label: Raised printing

possibleDefects.desc: The papel is wrong or doesn't contain small red and blue fibers.
possibleDefects.label: Paper

possibleDefects.desc: The colors in the background are wrong.
possibleDefects.label: Color

possibleDefects.desc: The portrait or the vignette are wrong.
possibleDefects.label: Portrait and vignette

possibleDefects.desc: Some of the symbols in the background are missing or are badly printed.
possibleDefects.label: Symbols of freedom

possibleDefects.desc: The seal of the U.S. Department of the Treasury is wrong or isn't in the right place.
possibleDefects.label: Green seal

possibleDefects.desc: The serial numbers are badly printed or don't have the right format.
